abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment for the
            Sri Lanka North East Irrigated Agriculture Project
            anticipates negative environmental impacts and proposes
            measures to mitigate them. The project repairs small
            irrigation schemes and rural roads, and builds community
            buildings and drinking water wells. To reduce accelerated
            soil erosion, restrict construction to the dry season,
            retain ground vegetation, retain channel/drainage
            reservation, turf exposed surfaces quickly, and create
            contour strips/steps as slope breakers. To prevent water
            logging and flooding, rehabilitate borrow areas, reshape
            excavated areas, and design proper drainage. Retain ground
            cover to reduce soil erosion, dump vegetation and scraped
            earth at suitable location and compact, and avoid clogging
            natural drainages. Use a clay cut off wall and ruble packing
            and toe filler to stem seepage. Retain natural vegetation
            and avoid cutting large trees. Mobilize community to prevent
            encroachment, fires, and tree cutting in catchment areas.
            Control dust by water and cover excavated soil material
            during transport. Train farmers in water management,
            conservation agriculture, organic farming, and integrated
            pest management. Create awareness of proper handling,
            storage, and disposal of pesticides and insecticides. Locate
            wells away from agricultural lands and drainages, dumping
            grounds, latrines, and saline deposits to prevent
            groundwater contamination from runoff and salinization.
